Notes.Text:
This update for python-djangorestframework fixes the following issues:

Update to 3.11.2

* Security: Drop urlize_quoted_links template tag in favour of 
  Django's built-in urlize. Removes a XSS vulnerability for some 
  kinds of content in the browsable API. (boo#1177205, CVE-2020-25626)
* update Django for APIs book to 3.0 edition
* decode base64 credentials as utf8; adjust tests
* Remove compat urls for Django < 2.0

This update was imported from the openSUSE:Leap:15.2:Update update project.
Notes.Title: Details

Notes.Text: The CVRF data is provided by SUSE under the Creative Commons License 4.0 with Attribution (CC-BY-4.0).
Notes.Title: Terms of Use

Vulnerabilities.Description: A flaw was found in Django REST Framework versions before 3.12.0 and before 3.11.2. When using the browseable API viewer, Django REST Framework fails to properly escape certain strings that can come from user input. This allows a user who can control those strings to inject malicious <script> tags, leading to a cross-site-scripting (XSS) vulnerability.
